channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLscienceAndDiscovery
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLscienceAndDiscovery, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Woodpeckers thrive where missiles fly. How a bombing range became a wildlife refuge
item.description: In a surprising twist of conservation success, a U.S. Air Force bombing range in Florida has become a sanctuary for endangered species like the red-co...

item.title: These butterflies look the same, but DNA uncovered six hidden species
item.description: Glasswing butterflies may all look alike, but behind their transparent wings hides an evolutionary story full of intrigue. Researchers discovered that...

item.title: This star survived its own supernova and shined even brighter
item.description: In a spectacular image captured by the Hubble Space Telescope, the spiral galaxy NGC 1309 glows with cosmic elegance and hides a strange survivor.

item.title: NASA’s most advanced radar ever will track earthquakes, landslides, and ice loss from space
item.description: NASA and ISRO have launched NISAR, a groundbreaking radar satellite that will monitor natural disasters and environmental changes across Earth. It can...

item.title: Scientists reexamine 47-year-old fossil and discover a new Jurassic sea monster

item.title: NSF announces $100 million investment in National Artificial Intelligence Research Institutes awards to secure American leadership in AI

item.title: NSF Graduate Research Fellow helps turn 'forever chemicals' into valuable resource
